title: The strange mechanics of Yasuo wind wall
body:
The consistency of the definition projectile for {{champion:157}} 's wind wall seems to be quiet inconsistent. 

For example:
Blocks {{champion:163}} ult, when she is on the wall, making it come from the ground, so how is it a projectile.
Does not block {{champion:99}} ult.
Does block {{champion:268}} sands soldiers auto attacks, when they are a entity within themselves that are melee.
Cant block {{item:3146}}  active, when that is a projectile going from one place to another, at a range.

Im sure there will be more abilities that dont seem logical with {{champion:157}} 's wind wall, but can someone explain the things i have picked up so far?
{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}

replies.body: So to put it simply because Taliyah ult wall is coded the way it is. It counts as a projectile and the raising from the ground you see is just the animation. Same with azir sand soldier they are coded as projects. Same reason why braums unbreakable will stop Taliyah’s ult. Now the reason wind wall doesn’t stop final spark is because it’s not coded as a projectile but it’s coded as a beam. That goes that full distance instantly. Same reason why xerath q and vel’koz ult won’t be stoped by wind wall. They are beams, not projectiles.

So what your saying is that beams or not projectiles 
So that would make sense for {{item:3146}} as well?
